intro: Pisonia austro-orientalis, commonly known as the Australian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a velvety texture. Pisonia austro-orientalis thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and salty sea breezes.
